articles.content:
Powell's projected tour of S. Korea protested
    Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The joint measure committee for checking the "Missile Defense" system and realizing peace held a press conference on July 25 as regards U.S. Secretary of State Powell's projected visit to South Korea at which it declared its opposition to the U.S. pressure upon South Korea to join in the MD and buy U.S.-made weapons, Seoul-based Yonhap News reported.
 Saying that Powell will come to South Korea in the capacity of a special envoy to convey the U.S. administration's order to sell and deploy weapons worth 13 trillion won in South Korea and turn the north into a testing ground for the MD, the organization urged the South Korean authorities to officially declare South Korea's non-participation in the MD.    
 It decided to adopt letters of protest to the U.S. and the South Korean authorities to the effect that the MD is obstructive to the peaceful reunification of the Korean peninsula, hold a rally denouncing his tour of South Korea and stage a demonstration, a cyber demonstration, etc. before and after his visit.
